result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheila M Smulders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheila M Smulders

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 10:14am 
Defendant Sheila M Smulders in court with Attorney Francis Raff. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court grants the State leave to file an Amended Informatoin. 
Service of the Amended Information is admitted, reading is waived; the misdemeanor charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Constitutional rights are reviewed; Elements are recited; plea of " No Contest " is entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Ms. Smulders:
--to serve 7 days in the Jefferson County Jail
--days credit for time already served:  7 days
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs and surcharges [clerk's calculation of total: $453] . The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay. Non-payment will result in the entry of a civil judgment. 
recess 10:24am

Pre-trial conference on June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 11:09am 
Defendant Sheila M Smulders in court with Attorney Francis P Raff.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Ms. Smulders waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 11:12am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/22/22 at  9:00am   (2) Status Conference on 6/23/22 at 10:00am
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Order to Reschedule May 6, 2022 Hearing

ec: DA and Atty Raff(5/6/22--ma)
Proposed Order to Reschedule May 6, 2022 Hearing
Status conference on May 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Phone number updated submitted by defendant

[ml] Case called at 8:58AM
Defendant Sheila M Smulders in court, without counsel. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing, however the Defendant has not yet been appointed counsel.
The Defendant advises the Court that she wishes to proceed with a lawyer.
The State requests that the Court continue to toll Preliminary Hearing time limits, and schedule this matter for a Status of Counsel hearing. The Defendant does not object to this scheduling.
The Court continues to toll Preliminary Hearing time limits.

recess 9:00AM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 05/06 at 11:30AM
Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Case called at [All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Sheila M Smulders appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel)appears.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no discussion of the case with Orlando Young
--not to possess or use Quest cards or other financial transaction cards not in own name
recess 2:05 pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 3/29/22 at 9:00am
